summary: An ordinance relating to and providing for the improvement of Boylston Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, from Thomas Street to the south line of the Supplemental Plat of A. Pontius' Addition to the City of Seattle, by constructing concrete sidewalks thereon, together with all necessary appurtenances, all in accordance with Resolution No. 297 of the city council of the City of Seattle; and providing payment therefor by the mode of "Payment in Bonds" as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency", approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899."
